basics.name: Qiye Zhou
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Backend-focused software engineer with MSc in Computing and 2+ years of hands-on experience building Python/Flask applications. Specialised in RESTful API development, database design, and real-time web applications using WebSocket. Strong foundation in AI integration, task automation, and VPS deployment. Seeking entry-level to junior backend/full-stack roles. UK resident with spouse visa work authorisation (no sponsorship required).

work.name: Dayingjia Leisure Club

Implemented booking system, payment integration, and user management features serving active user base
Architected scalable backend infrastructure to support real-time booking and customer relationship management
Conducted market research and competitive analysis to inform technical requirements and product roadmap

work.name: Magic Mirror LTD

highlights: Maintained client relationships with 10+ enterprise clients, ensuring timely delivery and 95%+ satisfaction rates

projects.name: AI Translation API
projects.description: RESTful API service providing AI-powered text translation with grammar proofreading capabilities
highlights: Built scalable Flask REST API with OpenAI integration for intelligent translation and proofreading
Implemented SQLite database with SQLAlchemy ORM for persistent translation history and user management
Developed background task scheduler using APScheduler for batch translation processing
Created responsive web interface using Tailwind CSS for API demonstration and testing
Designed health monitoring system for API, database, and scheduler service status tracking

projects.name: Py-Gomoku Online Game Platform
projects.description: Real-time multiplayer Gomoku (five-in-a-row) web application with spectator mode and live chat
highlights: Developed full-stack multiplayer game platform using Flask and WebSocket (Flask-SocketIO) for real-time gameplay
Implemented game room system supporting up to 12 concurrent participants (2 players + 10 spectators)
Built server-side game state management and turn-based timer using APScheduler with async event handling
Designed SQLAlchemy database schema for user accounts, game history, and session management
Created interactive frontend with move tracking, countdown display, and debug panel for development
Resolved complex threading/coroutine compatibility issues between Eventlet and BackgroundScheduler

highlights: Fine-tuned Tesseract OCR model on custom dataset to improve recognition accuracy for specific document types
Implemented Python-based data preprocessing pipeline for training data preparation
Conducted comparative analysis of model performance metrics before and after fine-tuning
Developed evaluation framework to measure OCR accuracy improvements across different text styles
